column2:
"As the false king fell, so did Cuent Castle.
Following this, Harriet declared a new capital."

"Because of the confusion regarding the collapse of the
castle, a provisional capital was formed from the adjacent city."

"While the relocation of people was successful, the challenge
that remained was, who would succeed the throne."

"While there was someone who met the
requirements, she had refused to agree upon it."
"As I thought, it's rather soon for me to ascend the throne! Please, Luther! Take my place instead!"
"As knowledge of the details regarding my succession has become common knowledge amongst the people, it'd be bad if you do not accept this."
"Without a successor to the throne, there will be endless chaos from the people... Harriet, you must become the ruler of this nation."
"That's right, I understand, however..."
"1. It's alright"
"2. Perhaps Luther should..."
"Guardian... While your words are encouraging..."
"Insistent are we. I had already told you that I had no place on the throne."
"Even in such emergencies, how far are you willing to go?"
"Did you honestly think that royalty should break the law? The thought never crossed your mind, did it fairy?"
"Harriet's still young. Wouldn't it be too early for her?"
"It's never too early or too late to take the throne. The important thing is whether they're worthy of it or not."
"From the east in Es-Ars, the head of the nation is no older than a young child."
"In the west, the King of Epic took to the throne when he was just 12 years old."
"Age does not matter. What does is if they have the resolve to sacrifice themselves to their nation."
"I have no intention of having such a resolve. Because of which, with my focus on advancing Magic, cost me my succession to the throne."
"However, my sister... Harriet has that resolve."
"Luther... And the Guardian."
"I understand..."
"In the name of the late king. I, Harriet Lean Rein Cuent, declare my enthronement."
"Guardian."
"Support us and guide us on the path we must follow. We are in your care."
